head.title: School Closure Information & COVID-19 (Coronavirus) Updates/Resources – Superintendent's Corner – Eastern Lancaster County School District

div.div: We would like to thank you for your ongoing patience and understanding during this unprecedented time. Please continue to visit the District website and follow us on our social media outlets where information about our school closure will be updated regularly.

div.p: We are pleased to announce that we have established an ELANCO technology support hotline. If your learner experiences a technical issue with their computer, login, or online content, please call or have them call us directly at (717) 354-1599. Our hotline hours are from 9:30am to 5:30pm Monday-Friday. If your learner experiences an issue outside of these hours, please leave message.

div.span: UPDATE 3/20/2020: If you were unable to pick up your child's computer or computer charger at the designated times indicated below, your building principals will be working with you to determine how to get those computers or charger to you.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none

div.span: UPDATE: Elementary student chargers: If your elementary child was absent and they don't have their computer, you can pick it up in addition to the charger on Thursday from 10am-12pm at their elementary school. Kindergarten students will NOT receive a computer or charger.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none

div.span: ELANCO Elementary Families: Elementary Learner Computer chargers will be made available for pick up at your child’s elementary school on Thursday, March 19, 2020 from 10:00 am to 12:00 pm. with a second pick up time that evening, 5:00 -7:00 pm. at the Garden Spot Campus.

div.p: UPDATE 4/16/2020 - Please note the change in meal distribution times and the route for picking up meals.

UPDATE: 4/7/2020 - All meal distribution will be moved to Garden Spot High School Starting next Tuesday April 14th and we will be closing our other 2 sites in New Holland. We are also going to only be distributing meals 1 day a week (every Tuesday) giving families 5 days’ worth of breakfast and lunches. See Flyer Below for more details. If you have any additional questions, please contact Director of Food Services, Jami Leisey at jami_leisey@elanco.org.

strong.span: This site contains links to optional enrichment resources available to families to use during breaks from school. Resources are available for elementary and secondary learners. Please check regularly as resources will be updated. Remember that reading books or other text of interest is an excellent way to enrich learning. These resources are NOT mandatory for learners to use but are for enrichment purposes.

div.div: At this time, all learner registrations will be put on hold until further notice.
